job.title: Software Engineer I
job.description:
Why APCON?
At APCON, we are committed to setting the industry standard by engineering best-in-class network solutions. We're talented, driven, and willing to roll up our sleeves to make what seems impossible possible. As our industry grows, we are rapidly expanding and looking for talented, committed, and motivated employees to thrive in our fast-paced work environment. Join us and work with industry-leading hardware and software engineers as we develop some of the most innovative technologies shaping the future of network monitoring.
Purpose Of Job
The Software Engineer I will be responsible for writing Enterprise Application code in a team environment which includes research, design, debug, and test for next generation network management software systems while contributing to the existing product line.
Responsibilities
Design, implement, debug, and test server-side software for network management software
Work closely with firmware design team
Work closely with the quality assurance group for testing
Responsible for creating written documentation for his/her own software development
Develop feature enhancements and provide development support for existing product lines
Works in both an independent and team member environment to meet multiple product release cycles
Qualifications And Requirements
Hands on experience developing applications in C/C++
Proficient in object oriented analysis, design and development techniques
Working knowledge of RPC, REST API or other programming interfaces
Knowledge of golang and QT framework a Plus
Experience working with databases like MySQL
Knowledge of Angular/JavaScript/HTML5 a Plus
Core Competencies
Knowledge of Version Control practices, especially SVN
Ability to prioritize and be flexible in a fast-paced environment
Strong interpersonal skills; ability to communicate professionally across the organization
Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality and professionalism
Ability to manage, and schedule time to meet deadlines
Education
BS degree (BSEE or BSCS strongly preferred, MSCS a plus) or the equivalent in training and experience
2+ years of programming experience (C/C++, REST)
Benefits
Medical, dental and vision insurance
Company-paid short and long term disability
Flexible spending accounts
Healthy work-life balance and generous paid time off program
Retirement savings match
Professional development program
Volunteer time off and employee assistance plan
Collaborative and innovative work environment
On-site exercise facility
APCON is a drug-free workplace and EEO Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, natural origin, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or other legally protected status. Offers are contingent on the successful completion of pre-employment drug and background screenings. Please note that we follow Federal Guidelines regarding prohibited substances, even for those legal at the state level.
